name: Red Pasta Sauce

ingredients.prep: drained of the canning liquid (only use the tomatoes themselves)

steps: Heat 3 Tbsp of Olive Oil in a stainless-steel pot or dutch oven
Add Onions, stirring occasionally as they soften (should take a few minutes)
Push the onions to the sides of the pot, clearing a space at the center
Briefly (~10 seconds) toast the Red Pepper Flakes and Oregano in the center
Stir in the now toasted spices, and add the 8 cloves of crushed Garlic
Re-clear the center of the pot, and add the Tomato Paste
Let Tomato Paste toast in the center until the fond looks like its about to burn
Stir Tomato Taste in quickly deglaze with 3/4 Cup of Chardonnay
Scrape and stir with your wooden spoon until all the fond from the bottom is mixed in
Stir in the drained can of San Marzano tomatoes
Break up the tomatoes until slightly chunkier than is desired for the end product
Mix in the Ground Peeled Tomatoes
comments: This recipe really benefits from some mise en place, particulary for the beginning steps
This is a recipe where the specified brands really matter, as each has a distinct taste
